settings.step_1_txt: The Event cards will influence all players during the game. Through the Event cards, you can gain or lose money.
settings.step_1_title1: Basically, you need to gain the most money
settings.step_1_txt1: Than you can claim the title of The Greatest Investor ever!
settings.step_1_title2: If you don't protect yourself, you lose
settings.step_1_txt2: Hit to many bad events for your portfolio and go bankrupt!
settings.step_1_txt3: The different opportunities will teach each player how crucial it is to think about money and what to do with it!
settings.step_2_txt1: Provide all players with the next assets: - 1x The Netherlands AEX Stocks - 1x US S&P 500 Stocks - 1x Real Estate Amsterdam - Apartment - 1x All World ETF - 10,000 in cash
settings.step_2_txt2: Point out one player who will play the bank. This player manages the money and the put and call options
settings.step_2_txt3: On the beginning of every round, players can choose to buy either a put or a call option. When all players have played their rounds. The puts and calls can be bought again.
settings.step_2_txt4: When everybody had the choice to buy a put or call, the youngest player can start the game.
settings.step_2_txt5: Every player has 2 actions to complete.
settings.step_2_txt6: Action1: Draw an asset card and make the choice what you are doing with it
settings.step_2_txt7: Action 2: Draw an event card and carry out the action on the card. The action influences all players.
settings.step_2_txt8: The game is finished when all the Event cards are played.
settings.step_2_txt9: Count the total value of your portfolio and half of your remaining cash. The player with the most value can claim the title on The Greatest Investor ever.

settings.text: The Greatest Investor is a game developed by a Dutch company called "Beleggingsinstituut".

settings.heading: Our founders
settings.founder_desc: Started by former Xbox game designer Elan Lee and The Oatmeal’s founder Matt Inman, The Greatest Investor and its family of games recreates game night for a humorous and fun.

settings.text: If you have questions that are not answered below, don't be shy

settings.title: Do you accept game idea submissions?
1.	How many players does the game support?
settings.answer: The Greatest Investor is destined for 2 to 5 players. If you want to play with more, you’ll need to buy a second deck, which can accommodate for up to 8 players.

settings.title: 2.	What’s the age range?
settings.answer: The Greatest Investor is suitable for 12+. The card designs are safe-for-work and kid-friendly.

settings.title: 3.	How long does it take to learn?
settings.answer: Learning how to play only takes a few minutes. It’s an easy game to jump into without a steep learning curve or time investment. After all, time is money too. ;-)

settings.title: 4.	How long does it take to play?
settings.answer: The average game will last between the 30 and 45 minutes. If you want to play a quicker game, you can split the Event card deck in half (recommended when played with two players).

settings.title: 5.	What’s included in the game?
settings.answer:
A 210 card deck of The Greatest Investor, box, instructions, and a
investment bonus, if chosen for the limited edition.

settings.title: 6.	Can I get The Greatest Investor in other languages?
settings.answer: For the time being, we only have an English language version of the game available. The instructions are in Dutch and English and online also in German, France and Spanish.

settings.title: 7.	Do you offer international shipping?
settings.answer: Of course! You can find the prices for shipment to anywhere in the world by selecting your game and choosing your location in the shipment menu.

settings.title: 8.	Can I pay without a credit card?
settings.answer: Yes, you can! Besides a credit card, we accept Apple Pay, Ideal, Bancontact and Klara Afterpay.

settings.title: 9.	How many cards are in the deck?
10.	What’s in the box?
settings.answer:
Your shiny new The Greatest Investor box is designed with room for up to 3 decks and the
instructions. Plus one extra slot for an add-on deck of cards.

settings.heading: How it all started
settings.desc:
The Greatest Investor started when Tom & Thomas wanted to create a great way to learn more about the basic dynamics of investing while keeping it accessible without bargaining away the fun.

Over the next few weeks, two important things happened: First, Tom & Thomas developed a rule-set that started working and brought the game to life. Second, Tom & Thomas created a prototype which had much to do with literally pasting together the cards on a standard card game deck and play away to iron out the kinks, and make the game not only easy to learn, but exciting to play. And what could be cooler than outsmarting your friends and making a shitload of money?

But we also wanted to up the stakes with a title to be claimed only by the winner. And so, "The Greatest Investor" was born.
